tool.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: something that you hold in your hand and use to do a particular job
tool.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: I don’t have the right tools to start fiddling around with the engine.
tool.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: a piece of equipment or a skill that is useful for doing your job
tool.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: Television is an important tool for the modern teacher.

tool.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: someone who is used unfairly by another person and who has to do things they do not really want to do – used to show disapproval
tool.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: The king was merely a tool of the military government.
tool.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: to drive along a street, especially for fun
tool.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: He spent the afternoon tooling around town.
tool.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: an object, piece of equipment, or device used for making things

tool.translation[2].definitions[1].defin: a skill or method of doing a particular task
